Statement Text: Human infection is rare but can occur after close contact with an infected animal.

There is no record of Americans contracting highly pathogenic avian flu viruses, but worldwide, 864 people have contracted it [highly pathogenic avian flu viruses] since 2003, resulting in 456 deaths, according to the CDC and WHO.
Authorities in eastern Poland say bird flu is responsible for the deaths of at least 25,000 turkeys in poultry farms near the country's borders with Ukraine and Belarus.
Polish veterinary authorities on Thursday were planning to cull tens of thousands of birds in the Lubartow area, a major poultry farming region.
Police were blocking access to the affected area to non-residents.
